answerText: Waiting for Godot or En Attendant Godot[10] Waiting for Godot was written by this Irish playwright.
heading: DRAGOON |2013 | 9 | 7 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: In its first act, one character in this play gives a monologue in which he intersperses nonsense words like "quaquaqua" and "anthropopopometry" into a profound speech. [10] Name this two-act tragicomedy that begins with one of its principal characters trying to remove his boot. Both acts end with the stage direction "They do not move."
